p: The WHO and other organisations are developing action plans to counter the growing antimicrobial resistance problem [ 1]. They have called for a One Health approach which involves stakeholders from all sectors and disciplines since AMR will affect everyone regardless of health condition. Interestingly, many whole medical systems, for instance anthroposophic medicine, traditional Chinese medicine and Ayurveda have developed clinical practices that make use of far less antibiotics than modern medicine [ 2]. Furthermore, there is evidence that general practitioners additionally trained in integrative medicine practices prescribe fewer antibiotics [ 3]. However, it appears that the chances offered by integrative medicine practices have not yet been considered by the WHO global action plan.
